BULLETIN NO. 145 
CORE PRINCIPLES 
- CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENTS 
28/9/2022 
 
Summary 
Core Principles were first issued in July 2008 and are regularly reviewed to provide guidance for airport aviation 
fuel storage and/or hydrant and/or into-plane operations (Joint Ventures and Throughput Locations) on the control 
of Sensitive Information to ensure all parties comply with competition (antitrust) law. 
Following the most recent review some adjustments were made to the Tier 1, Tier 2 and tier 3 Confidentiality 
Agreements as described below. 
 
General Changes to the Confidentiality Agreements: 
1. The Agreements have been adjusted where necessary to make a clearer distinction between Joint Ventures and 
Operators. This is helpful in cases where the management of JVs has been outsourced to 3rd Parties. 
2. The definition of "Core Principles" has been updated to always include the latest published version instead of 
the one annexed to the Agreements. 
3. The "Governing Law" clause has been amended to allow signatories to choose their legal jurisdiction and 
include an Arbitration provision should they wish to do so. 
 
Use of Confidentiality Agreements: 
Following this review, there is a new good practice recommendation for Incorporated JVs directly running 
operations is to also complete a Tier 1 Agreement between the Company/Operator and the Users/Throughputters.

All Users and Operators who use the JIG Template Agreements are recommended to use the latest versions as

Access to reference documents 
The Confidentiality Agreements can be downloaded from the Standards and Publications page on the JIG website, 
https://www.jig.org/standards-publications/ . Users should select the "Policy & Governance" Tab and can filter by 
"CP Core Principles". 
The updated Agreements are: CP 1.05, !.06, 1.07, 1.09, 1.10, 1.16, 1.17 and 1.18. 
The following Training Packs have also been updated: CP 1.12, 1.14, 1.19 and 1.20. 
 
The supporting Training Packs for Sites, Operators and Throughputters have also been updated and can be 
downloaded from the same page of the website.
